result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

matter scheduled for IA 5/23/22 at 1:15
Initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Eugene K Schmidt not in court, Attorney Anne Renc for Eugene K Schmidt appeared in court. 
Both files heard: 22CF103, 22CM12

Atty Cassidy calls the cases.  Defendant was present on video conferencing, however they received info that they were getting too close to their intake time and the matter to be rescheduled. 
Defendant is in Marathon County. 
Atty Renc asks to do this on a different day as this is now the 3rd time this has happened. 
Court questions the parties. 
Atty Renc responds. 
Court suggests contacting the Branch 1 judge to schedule. 
Atty Renc asks to meet with the JA to set up a time. 
Atty Cassidy indicates she is not the attorney on this case.  The matter will need to be scheduled with Atty Jambois. 
Court questions Atty Renc regarding the custody status of the defendant. 
Atty Renc responds.

Filed by the State:  Adjourned IA set for 3/21/22 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2 
   Reschedule both IAs, Marathon County Jail was not able to accommodate a 
   remote appearance for 3/14. Confirmed time for new date
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

02:27 PM Defendant Eugene K Schmidt not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Mutchler requests to adjourn due to Marathon County jail is having issues with zoom.  
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
(sent to JR)

Cases recalled at 2:15 PM.  Atty Renc informs the Court her client is in the Marathon County Jail.
BY THE COURT: Warrant is quashed - not issued.
Matter now is rescheduled.
02:12 PM Defendant Eugene K Schmidt not in court. Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $250  cash alternative, adjacent counties
filed by Atty Anne Renc

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Initial Appearance set for January 24, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1
No contact with Walmart Stores in the State of Wisconsin.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft as Party to the Crime, 2 counts of Misdemeanor Bailjumping. 

State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments to the court. Requests a signature bond. 

Court finds probable cause. 
Court questions the defendant. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  1/24/22  @ 1:15 p.m.  in Branch 1
